write.rs

1use std::borrow::Borrow;
2use std::io;
3use std::ops::Range;
4
5use super::draw::{self, StreamAwareFmt, StreamType};
6use super::{Cache, CharSet, Label, LabelAttach, Report, ReportKind, Show, Span, Write};
7
8// A WARNING, FOR ALL YE WHO VENTURE IN HERE
9//
10// - This code is complex and has a lot of implicit invariants
11// - Yes, it has some bugs
12// - Yes, it needs rewriting
13// - No, you are not expected to understand it. I will probably not understand it either in a month, but that will only
14//   give me a reason to rewrite it
15
16enum LabelKind {
17    Inline,
18    Multiline,
19}
20
21struct LabelInfo<'a, S> {
22    kind: LabelKind,
23    label: &'a Label<S>,
24}
25
26struct SourceGroup<'a, S: Span> {
27    src_id: &'a S::SourceId,
28    span: Range<usize>,
29    labels: Vec<LabelInfo<'a, S>>,
30}
31
32impl<S: Span> Report<'_, S> {
33    fn get_source_groups(&self, cache: &mut impl Cache<S::SourceId>) -> Vec<SourceGroup<S>> {
34        let mut groups = Vec::new();
35        for label in self.labels.iter() {
36            let src_display = cache.display(label.span.source());
37            let src = match cache.fetch(label.span.source()) {
38                Ok(src) => src,
39                Err(e) => {
40                    eprintln!("Unable to fetch source '{}': {:?}", Show(src_display), e);
41                    continue;
42                }
43            };
44
45            let start_line = src.get_offset_line(label.span.start()).map(|(_, l, _)| l);
46            let end_line = src
47                .get_offset_line(label.span.end().saturating_sub(1).max(label.span.start()))
48                .map(|(_, l, _)| l);
49
50            let label_info = LabelInfo {
51                kind: if start_line == end_line {
52                    LabelKind::Inline
53                } else {
54                    LabelKind::Multiline
55                },
56                label,
57            };
58
59            if let Some(group) = groups
60                .iter_mut()
61                .find(|g: &&mut SourceGroup<S>| g.src_id == label.span.source())
62            {
63                group.span.start = group.span.start.min(label.span.start());
64                group.span.end = group.span.end.max(label.span.end());
65                group.labels.push(label_info);
66            } else {
67                groups.push(SourceGroup {
68                    src_id: label.span.source(),
69                    span: label.span.start()..label.span.end(),
70                    labels: vec![label_info],
71                });
72            }
73        }
74        groups
75    }
76
77    /// Write this diagnostic to an implementor of [`Write`].
78    ///
79    /// If using the `concolor` feature, this method assumes that the output is ultimately going to be printed to
80    /// `stderr`.  If you are printing to `stdout`, use the [`write_for_stdout`](Self::write_for_stdout) method instead.
81    ///
82    /// If you wish to write to `stderr` or `stdout`, you can do so via [`Report::eprint`] or [`Report::print`] respectively.
83    pub fn write<C: Cache<S::SourceId>, W: Write>(&self, cache: C, w: W) -> io::Result<()> {
84        self.write_for_stream(cache, w, StreamType::Stderr)
85    }
86
87    /// Write this diagnostic to an implementor of [`Write`], assuming that the output is ultimately going to be printed
88    /// to `stdout`.
89    pub fn write_for_stdout<C: Cache<S::SourceId>, W: Write>(
90        &self,
91        cache: C,
92        w: W,
93    ) -> io::Result<()> {
94        self.write_for_stream(cache, w, StreamType::Stdout)
95    }
96
97    /// Write this diagnostic to an implementor of [`Write`], assuming that the output is ultimately going to be printed
98    /// to the given output stream (`stdout` or `stderr`).
99    fn write_for_stream<C: Cache<S::SourceId>, W: Write>(
100        &self,
101        mut cache: C,
102        mut w: W,
103        s: StreamType,
104    ) -> io::Result<()> {
105        let draw = match self.config.char_set {
106            CharSet::Unicode => draw::Characters::unicode(),
107            CharSet::Ascii => draw::Characters::ascii(),
108        };
109
110        // --- Header ---
111
112        let code = self.code.as_ref().map(|c| format!("[{}] ", c));
113        let id = format!("{}{}:", Show(code), self.kind);
114        let kind_color = match self.kind {
115            ReportKind::Error => self.config.error_color(),
116            ReportKind::Warning => self.config.warning_color(),
117            ReportKind::Advice => self.config.advice_color(),
118            ReportKind::Custom(_, color) => Some(color),
119        };
120        writeln!(w, "{} {}", id.fg(kind_color, s), Show(self.msg.as_ref()))?;
121
122        let groups = self.get_source_groups(&mut cache);
123
124        // Line number maximum width
125        let line_no_width = groups
126            .iter()
127            .filter_map(|SourceGroup { span, src_id, .. }| {
128                let src_name = cache
129                    .display(src_id)
130                    .map(|d| d.to_string())
131                    .unwrap_or_else(|| "<unknown>".to_string());
132
133                let src = match cache.fetch(src_id) {
134                    Ok(src) => src,
135                    Err(e) => {
136                        eprintln!("Unable to fetch source {}: {:?}", src_name, e);
137                        return None;
138                    }
139                };
140
141                let line_range = src.get_line_range(span);
142                Some(
143                    (1..)
144                        .map(|x| 10u32.pow(x))
145                        .take_while(|x| line_range.end as u32 / x != 0)
146                        .count()
147                        + 1,
148                )
149            })
150            .max()
151            .unwrap_or(0);
152
153        // --- Source sections ---
154        let groups_len = groups.len();
155        for (
156            group_idx,
157            SourceGroup {
158                src_id,
159                span,
160                labels,
161            },
162        ) in groups.into_iter().enumerate()
163        {
164            let src_name = cache
165                .display(src_id)
166                .map(|d| d.to_string())
167                .unwrap_or_else(|| "<unknown>".to_string());
168
169            let src = match cache.fetch(src_id) {
170                Ok(src) => src,
171                Err(e) => {
172                    eprintln!("Unable to fetch source {}: {:?}", src_name, e);
173                    continue;
174                }
175            };
176
177            let line_range = src.get_line_range(&span);
178
179            // File name & reference
180            let location = if src_id == self.location.0.borrow() {
181                self.location.1
182            } else {
183                labels[0].label.span.start()
184            };
185            let (line_no, col_no) = src
186                .get_offset_line(location)
187                .map(|(_, idx, col)| (format!("{}", idx + 1), format!("{}", col + 1)))
188                .unwrap_or_else(|| ('?'.to_string(), '?'.to_string()));
189            let line_ref = format!(":{}:{}", line_no, col_no);
190            writeln!(
191                w,
192                "{}{}{}{}{}{}{}",
193                Show((' ', line_no_width + 2)),
194                if group_idx == 0 {
195                    draw.ltop
196                } else {
197                    draw.lcross
198                }
199                .fg(self.config.margin_color(), s),
200                draw.hbar.fg(self.config.margin_color(), s),
201                draw.lbox.fg(self.config.margin_color(), s),
202                src_name,
203                line_ref,
204                draw.rbox.fg(self.config.margin_color(), s),
205            )?;
206
207            if !self.config.compact {
208                writeln!(
209                    w,
210                    "{}{}",
211                    Show((' ', line_no_width + 2)),
212                    draw.vbar.fg(self.config.margin_color(), s)
213                )?;
214            }
215
216            struct LineLabel<'a, S> {
217                col: usize,
218                label: &'a Label<S>,
219                multi: bool,
220                draw_msg: bool,
221            }
222
223            // Generate a list of multi-line labels
224            let mut multi_labels = Vec::new();
225            let mut multi_labels_with_message = Vec::new();
226            for label_info in &labels {
227                if matches!(label_info.kind, LabelKind::Multiline) {
228                    multi_labels.push(&label_info.label);
229                    if label_info.label.msg.is_some() {
230                        multi_labels_with_message.push(&label_info.label);
231                    }
232                }
233            }
234
235            // Sort multiline labels by length
236            multi_labels.sort_by_key(|m| -(m.span.len() as isize));
237            multi_labels_with_message.sort_by_key(|m| -(m.span.len() as isize));
238
239            let write_margin = |w: &mut W,
240                                idx: usize,
241                                is_line: bool,
242                                is_ellipsis: bool,
243                                draw_labels: bool,
244                                report_row: Option<(usize, bool)>,
245                                line_labels: &[LineLabel<S>],
246                                margin_label: &Option<LineLabel<S>>|
247             -> std::io::Result<()> {
248                let line_no_margin = if is_line && !is_ellipsis {
249                    let line_no = format!("{}", idx + 1);
250                    format!(
251                        "{}{} {}",
252                        Show((' ', line_no_width - line_no.chars().count())),
253                        line_no,
254                        draw.vbar,
255                    )
256                    .fg(self.config.margin_color(), s)
257                } else {
258                    format!(
259                        "{}{}",
260                        Show((' ', line_no_width + 1)),
261                        if is_ellipsis {
262                            draw.vbar_gap
263                        } else {
264                            draw.vbar
265                        }
266                    )
267                    .fg(self.config.skipped_margin_color(), s)
268                };
269
270                write!(
271                    w,
272                    " {}{}",
273                    line_no_margin,
274                    Show(Some(' ').filter(|_| !self.config.compact)),
275                )?;
276
277                // Multi-line margins
278                if draw_labels {
279                    for col in 0..multi_labels_with_message.len() + (multi_labels_with_message.len() > 0) as usize {
280                        let mut corner = None;
281                        let mut hbar = None;
282                        let mut vbar: Option<&&Label<S>> = None;
283                        let mut margin_ptr = None;
284
285                        let multi_label = multi_labels_with_message.get(col);
286                        let line_span = src.line(idx).unwrap().span();
287
288                        for (i, label) in multi_labels_with_message[0..(col + 1).min(multi_labels_with_message.len())]
289                            .iter()
290                            .enumerate()
291                        {
292                            let margin = margin_label
293                                .as_ref()
294                                .filter(|m| **label as *const _ == m.label as *const _);
295
296                            if label.span.start() <= line_span.end
297                                && label.span.end() > line_span.start
298                            {
299                                let is_parent = i != col;
300                                let is_start = line_span.contains(&label.span.start());
301                                let is_end = line_span.contains(&label.last_offset());
302
303                                if let Some(margin) = margin.filter(|_| is_line) {
304                                    margin_ptr = Some((margin, is_start));
305                                } else if !is_start && (!is_end || is_line) {
306                                    vbar = vbar.or(Some(*label).filter(|_| !is_parent));
307                                } else if let Some((report_row, is_arrow)) = report_row {
308                                    let label_row = line_labels
309                                        .iter()
310                                        .enumerate()
311                                        .find(|(_, l)| **label as *const _ == l.label as *const _)
312                                        .map_or(0, |(r, _)| r);
313                                    if report_row == label_row {
314                                        if let Some(margin) = margin {
315                                            vbar = Some(&margin.label).filter(|_| col == i);
316                                            if is_start {
317                                                continue;
318                                            }
319                                        }
320
321                                        if is_arrow {
322                                            hbar = Some(**label);
323                                            if !is_parent {
324                                                corner = Some((label, is_start));
325                                            }
326                                        } else if !is_start {
327                                            vbar = vbar.or(Some(*label).filter(|_| !is_parent));
328                                        }
329                                    } else {
330                                        vbar = vbar.or(Some(*label).filter(|_| {
331                                            !is_parent && (is_start ^ (report_row < label_row))
332                                        }));
333                                    }
334                                }
335                            }
336                        }
337
338                        if let (Some((margin, _is_start)), true) = (margin_ptr, is_line) {
339                            let is_col = multi_label
340                                .map_or(false, |ml| **ml as *const _ == margin.label as *const _);
341                            let is_limit = col + 1 == multi_labels_with_message.len();
342                            if !is_col && !is_limit {
343                                hbar = hbar.or(Some(margin.label));
344                            }
345                        }
346
347                        hbar = hbar.filter(|l| {
348                            margin_label
349                                .as_ref()
350                                .map_or(true, |margin| margin.label as *const _ != *l as *const _)
351                                || !is_line
352                        });
353
354                        let (a, b) = if let Some((label, is_start)) = corner {
355                            (
356                                if is_start { draw.ltop } else { draw.lbot }.fg(label.color, s),
357                                draw.hbar.fg(label.color, s),
358                            )
359                        } else if let Some(label) =
360                            hbar.filter(|_| vbar.is_some() && !self.config.cross_gap)
361                        {
362                            (draw.xbar.fg(label.color, s), draw.hbar.fg(label.color, s))
363                        } else if let Some(label) = hbar {
364                            (draw.hbar.fg(label.color, s), draw.hbar.fg(label.color, s))
365                        } else if let Some(label) = vbar {
366                            (
367                                if is_ellipsis {
368                                    draw.vbar_gap
369                                } else {
370                                    draw.vbar
371                                }
372                                .fg(label.color, s),
373                                ' '.fg(None, s),
374                            )
375                        } else if let (Some((margin, is_start)), true) = (margin_ptr, is_line) {
376                            let is_col = multi_label
377                                .map_or(false, |ml| **ml as *const _ == margin.label as *const _);
378                            let is_limit = col == multi_labels_with_message.len();
379                            (
380                                if is_limit {
381                                    draw.rarrow
382                                } else if is_col {
383                                    if is_start {
384                                        draw.ltop
385                                    } else {
386                                        draw.lcross
387                                    }
388                                } else {
389                                    draw.hbar
390                                }
391                                .fg(margin.label.color, s),
392                                if !is_limit { draw.hbar } else { ' ' }.fg(margin.label.color, s),
393                            )
394                        } else {
395                            (' '.fg(None, s), ' '.fg(None, s))
396                        };
397                        write!(w, "{}", a)?;
398                        if !self.config.compact {
399                            write!(w, "{}", b)?;
400                        }
401                    }
402                }
403
404                Ok(())
405            };
406
407            let mut is_ellipsis = false;
408            for idx in line_range {
409                let line = if let Some(line) = src.line(idx) {
410                    line
411                } else {
412                    continue;
413                };
414
415                let margin_label = multi_labels_with_message
416                    .iter()
417                    .enumerate()
418                    .filter_map(|(_i, label)| {
419                        let is_start = line.span().contains(&label.span.start());
420                        let is_end = line.span().contains(&label.last_offset());
421                        if is_start {
422                            // TODO: Check to see whether multi is the first on the start line or first on the end line
423                            Some(LineLabel {
424                                col: label.span.start() - line.offset(),
425                                label: **label,
426                                multi: true,
427                                draw_msg: false, // Multi-line spans don;t have their messages drawn at the start
428                            })
429                        } else if is_end {
430                            Some(LineLabel {
431                                col: label.last_offset() - line.offset(),
432                                label: **label,
433                                multi: true,
434                                draw_msg: true, // Multi-line spans have their messages drawn at the end
435                            })
436                        } else {
437                            None
438                        }
439                    })
440                    .min_by_key(|ll| (ll.col, !ll.label.span.start()));
441
442                // Generate a list of labels for this line, along with their label columns
443                let mut line_labels = multi_labels_with_message
444                    .iter()
445                    .enumerate()
446                    .filter_map(|(_i, label)| {
447                        let is_start = line.span().contains(&label.span.start());
448                        let is_end = line.span().contains(&label.last_offset());
449                        if is_start
450                            && margin_label
451                                .as_ref()
452                                .map_or(true, |m| **label as *const _ != m.label as *const _)
453                        {
454                            // TODO: Check to see whether multi is the first on the start line or first on the end line
455                            Some(LineLabel {
456                                col: label.span.start() - line.offset(),
457                                label: **label,
458                                multi: true,
459                                draw_msg: false, // Multi-line spans don;t have their messages drawn at the start
460                            })
461                        } else if is_end {
462                            Some(LineLabel {
463                                col: label.last_offset() - line.offset(),
464                                label: **label,
465                                multi: true,
466                                draw_msg: true, // Multi-line spans have their messages drawn at the end
467                            })
468                        } else {
469                            None
470                        }
471                    })
472                    .collect::<Vec<_>>();
473
474                for label_info in labels.iter().filter(|l| {
475                    l.label.span.start() >= line.span().start
476                        && l.label.span.end() <= line.span().end
477                }) {
478                    if matches!(label_info.kind, LabelKind::Inline) {
479                        line_labels.push(LineLabel {
480                            col: match &self.config.label_attach {
481                                LabelAttach::Start => label_info.label.span.start(),
482                                LabelAttach::Middle => {
483                                    (label_info.label.span.start() + label_info.label.span.end())
484                                        / 2
485                                }
486                                LabelAttach::End => label_info.label.last_offset(),
487                            }
488                            .max(label_info.label.span.start())
489                                - line.offset(),
490                            label: label_info.label,
491                            multi: false,
492                            draw_msg: true,
493                        });
494                    }
495                }
496
497                // Skip this line if we don't have labels for it
498                if line_labels.len() == 0 && margin_label.is_none() {
499                    let within_label = multi_labels
500                        .iter()
501                        .any(|label| label.span.contains(line.span().start()));
502                    if !is_ellipsis && within_label {
503                        is_ellipsis = true;
504                    } else {
505                        if !self.config.compact && !is_ellipsis {
506                            write_margin(&mut w, idx, false, is_ellipsis, false, None, &[], &None)?;
507                            write!(w, "\n")?;
508                        }
509                        is_ellipsis = true;
510                        continue;
511                    }
512                } else {
513                    is_ellipsis = false;
514                }
515
516                // Sort the labels by their columns
517                line_labels.sort_by_key(|ll| (ll.label.order, ll.col, !ll.label.span.start()));
518
519                // Determine label bounds so we know where to put error messages
520                let arrow_end_space = if self.config.compact { 1 } else { 2 };
521                let arrow_len = line_labels.iter().fold(0, |l, ll| {
522                    if ll.multi {
523                        line.len()
524                    } else {
525                        l.max(ll.label.span.end().saturating_sub(line.offset()))
526                    }
527                }) + arrow_end_space;
528
529                // Should we draw a vertical bar as part of a label arrow on this line?
530                let get_vbar = |col, row| {
531                    line_labels
532                        .iter()
533                        // Only labels with notes get an arrow
534                        .enumerate()
535                        .filter(|(_, ll)| {
536                            ll.label.msg.is_some()
537                                && margin_label
538                                    .as_ref()
539                                    .map_or(true, |m| ll.label as *const _ != m.label as *const _)
540                        })
541                        .find(|(j, ll)| {
542                            ll.col == col && ((row <= *j && !ll.multi) || (row <= *j && ll.multi))
543                        })
544                        .map(|(_, ll)| ll)
545                };
546
547                let get_highlight = |col| {
548                    margin_label
549                        .iter()
550                        .map(|ll| ll.label)
551                        .chain(multi_labels.iter().map(|l| **l))
552                        .chain(line_labels.iter().map(|l| l.label))
553                        .filter(|l| l.span.contains(line.offset() + col))
554                        // Prioritise displaying smaller spans
555                        .min_by_key(|l| (-l.priority, l.span.len()))
556                };
557
558                let get_underline = |col| {
559                    line_labels
560                        .iter()
561                        .filter(|ll| {
562                            self.config.underlines
563                        // Underlines only occur for inline spans (highlighting can occur for all spans)
564                        && !ll.multi
565                        && ll.label.span.contains(line.offset() + col)
566                        })
567                        // Prioritise displaying smaller spans
568                        .min_by_key(|ll| (-ll.label.priority, ll.label.span.len()))
569                };
570
571                // Margin
572                write_margin(
573                    &mut w,
574                    idx,
575                    true,
576                    is_ellipsis,
577                    true,
578                    None,
579                    &line_labels,
580                    &margin_label,
581                )?;
582
583                // Line
584                if !is_ellipsis {
585                    for (col, c) in src.get_line_text(line).unwrap().chars().enumerate() {
586                        let color = if let Some(highlight) = get_highlight(col) {
587                            highlight.color
588                        } else {
589                            self.config.unimportant_color()
590                        };
591                        let (c, width) = self.config.char_width(c, col);
592                        if c.is_whitespace() {
593                            for _ in 0..width {
594                                write!(w, "{}", c.fg(color, s))?;
595                            }
596                        } else {
597                            write!(w, "{}", c.fg(color, s))?;
598                        };
599                    }
600                }
601                write!(w, "\n")?;
602
603                // Arrows
604                for row in 0..line_labels.len() {
605                    let line_label = &line_labels[row];
606                    //No message to draw thus no arrow to draw
607                    if line_label.label.msg.is_none() {
608                        continue
609                    }
610                    if !self.config.compact {
611                        // Margin alternate
612                        write_margin(
613                            &mut w,
614                            idx,
615                            false,
616                            is_ellipsis,
617                            true,
618                            Some((row, false)),
619                            &line_labels,
620                            &margin_label,
621                        )?;
622                        // Lines alternate
623                        let mut chars = src.get_line_text(line).unwrap().chars();
624                        for col in 0..arrow_len {
625                            let width =
626                                chars.next().map_or(1, |c| self.config.char_width(c, col).1);
627
628                            let vbar = get_vbar(col, row);
629                            let underline = get_underline(col).filter(|_| row == 0);
630                            let [c, tail] = if let Some(vbar_ll) = vbar {
631                                let [c, tail] = if underline.is_some() {
632                                    // TODO: Is this good?
633                                    if vbar_ll.label.span.len() <= 1 || true {
634                                        [draw.underbar, draw.underline]
635                                    } else if line.offset() + col == vbar_ll.label.span.start() {
636                                        [draw.ltop, draw.underbar]
637                                    } else if line.offset() + col == vbar_ll.label.last_offset() {
638                                        [draw.rtop, draw.underbar]
639                                    } else {
640                                        [draw.underbar, draw.underline]
641                                    }
642                                } else if vbar_ll.multi && row == 0 && self.config.multiline_arrows
643                                {
644                                    [draw.uarrow, ' ']
645                                } else {
646                                    [draw.vbar, ' ']
647                                };
648                                [
649                                    c.fg(vbar_ll.label.color, s),
650                                    tail.fg(vbar_ll.label.color, s),
651                                ]
652                            } else if let Some(underline_ll) = underline {
653                                [draw.underline.fg(underline_ll.label.color, s); 2]
654                            } else {
655                                [' '.fg(None, s); 2]
656                            };
657
658                            for i in 0..width {
659                                write!(w, "{}", if i == 0 { c } else { tail })?;
660                            }
661                        }
662                        write!(w, "\n")?;
663                    }
664
665                    // Margin
666                    write_margin(
667                        &mut w,
668                        idx,
669                        false,
670                        is_ellipsis,
671                        true,
672                        Some((row, true)),
673                        &line_labels,
674                        &margin_label,
675                    )?;
676                    // Lines
677                    let mut chars = src.get_line_text(line).unwrap().chars();
678                    for col in 0..arrow_len {
679                        let width = chars.next().map_or(1, |c| self.config.char_width(c, col).1);
680
681                        let is_hbar = (((col > line_label.col) ^ line_label.multi)
682                            || (line_label.label.msg.is_some()
683                                && line_label.draw_msg
684                                && col > line_label.col))
685                            && line_label.label.msg.is_some();
686                        let [c, tail] = if col == line_label.col
687                            && line_label.label.msg.is_some()
688                            && margin_label.as_ref().map_or(true, |m| {
689                                line_label.label as *const _ != m.label as *const _
690                            }) {
691                            [
692                                if line_label.multi {
693                                    if line_label.draw_msg {
694                                        draw.mbot
695                                    } else {
696                                        draw.rbot
697                                    }
698                                } else {
699                                    draw.lbot
700                                }
701                                .fg(line_label.label.color, s),
702                                draw.hbar.fg(line_label.label.color, s),
703                            ]
704                        } else if let Some(vbar_ll) = get_vbar(col, row)
705                            .filter(|_| (col != line_label.col || line_label.label.msg.is_some()))
706                        {
707                            if !self.config.cross_gap && is_hbar {
708                                [
709                                    draw.xbar.fg(line_label.label.color, s),
710                                    ' '.fg(line_label.label.color, s),
711                                ]
712                            } else if is_hbar {
713                                [draw.hbar.fg(line_label.label.color, s); 2]
714                            } else {
715                                [
716                                    if vbar_ll.multi && row == 0 && self.config.compact {
717                                        draw.uarrow
718                                    } else {
719                                        draw.vbar
720                                    }
721                                    .fg(vbar_ll.label.color, s),
722                                    ' '.fg(line_label.label.color, s),
723                                ]
724                            }
725                        } else if is_hbar {
726                            [draw.hbar.fg(line_label.label.color, s); 2]
727                        } else {
728                            [' '.fg(None, s); 2]
729                        };
730
731                        if width > 0 {
732                            write!(w, "{}", c)?;
733                        }
734                        for _ in 1..width {
735                            write!(w, "{}", tail)?;
736                        }
737                    }
738                    if line_label.draw_msg {
739                        write!(w, " {}", Show(line_label.label.msg.as_ref()))?;
740                    }
741                    write!(w, "\n")?;
742                }
743            }
744
745            let is_final_group = group_idx + 1 == groups_len;
746
747            // Help
748            if let (Some(note), true) = (&self.help, is_final_group) {
749                if !self.config.compact {
750                    write_margin(&mut w, 0, false, false, true, Some((0, false)), &[], &None)?;
751                    write!(w, "\n")?;
752                }
753                write_margin(&mut w, 0, false, false, true, Some((0, false)), &[], &None)?;
754                write!(w, "{}: {}\n", "Help".fg(self.config.note_color(), s), note)?;
755            }
756
757            // Note
758            if let (Some(note), true) = (&self.note, is_final_group) {
759                if !self.config.compact {
760                    write_margin(&mut w, 0, false, false, true, Some((0, false)), &[], &None)?;
761                    write!(w, "\n")?;
762                }
763                write_margin(&mut w, 0, false, false, true, Some((0, false)), &[], &None)?;
764                write!(w, "{}: {}\n", "Note".fg(self.config.note_color(), s), note)?;
765            }
766
767            // Tail of report
768            if !self.config.compact {
769                if is_final_group {
770                    let final_margin =
771                        format!("{}{}", Show((draw.hbar, line_no_width + 2)), draw.rbot);
772                    writeln!(w, "{}", final_margin.fg(self.config.margin_color(), s))?;
773                } else {
774                    writeln!(
775                        w,
776                        "{}{}",
777                        Show((' ', line_no_width + 2)),
778                        draw.vbar.fg(self.config.margin_color(), s)
779                    )?;
780                }
781            }
782        }
783        Ok(())
784    }
785}
786
787impl<S: Span> Label<S> {
788    fn last_offset(&self) -> usize {
789        self.span.end().saturating_sub(1).max(self.span.start())
790    }
791}
792
793#[cfg(test)]
794mod tests {
795    //! These tests use [insta](https://insta.rs/). If you do `cargo install cargo-insta` you can
796    //! automatically update the snapshots with `cargo insta review` or `cargo insta accept`.
797    //!
798    //! When adding new tests you can leave the string in the `assert_snapshot!` macro call empty:
799    //!
800    //!     assert_snapshot!(msg, @"");
801    //!
802    //! and insta will fill it in.
803
804    use std::ops::Range;
805
806    use insta::assert_snapshot;
807
808    use crate::{Cache, CharSet, Config, Label, Report, ReportKind, Source, Span};
809
810    impl<S: Span> Report<'_, S> {
811        fn write_to_string<C: Cache<S::SourceId>>(&self, cache: C) -> String {
812            let mut vec = Vec::new();
813            self.write(cache, &mut vec).unwrap();
814            String::from_utf8(vec).unwrap()
815        }
816    }
817
818    fn no_color_and_ascii() -> Config {
819        Config::default()
820            .with_color(false)
821            // Using Ascii so that the inline snapshots display correctly
822            // even with fonts where characters like '┬' take up more space.
823            .with_char_set(CharSet::Ascii)
824    }
825
826    #[test]
827    fn one_message() {
828        let msg = Report::<Range<usize>>::build(ReportKind::Error, (), 0)
829            .with_config(no_color_and_ascii())
830            .with_message("can't compare apples with oranges")
831            .finish()
832            .write_to_string(Source::from(""));
833        assert_snapshot!(msg, @r###"
834        Error: can't compare apples with oranges
835        "###)
836    }
837
838    #[test]
839    fn two_labels_without_messages() {
840        let source = "apple == orange;";
841        let msg = Report::<Range<usize>>::build(ReportKind::Error, (), 0)
842            .with_config(no_color_and_ascii())
843            .with_message("can't compare apples with oranges")
844            .with_label(Label::new(0..5))
845            .with_label(Label::new(9..15))
846            .finish()
847            .write_to_string(Source::from(source));
848        // TODO: it would be nice if these spans still showed up (like codespan-reporting does)
849        assert_snapshot!(msg, @r###"
850        Error: can't compare apples with oranges
851           ,-[<unknown>:1:1]
852           |
853         1 | apple == orange;
854        ---'
855        "###);
856    }
857
858    #[test]
859    fn two_labels_with_messages() {
860        let source = "apple == orange;";
861        let msg = Report::<Range<usize>>::build(ReportKind::Error, (), 0)
862            .with_config(no_color_and_ascii())
863            .with_message("can't compare apples with oranges")
864            .with_label(Label::new(0..5).with_message("This is an apple"))
865            .with_label(Label::new(9..15).with_message("This is an orange"))
866            .finish()
867            .write_to_string(Source::from(source));
868        // TODO: it would be nice if these lines didn't cross
869        assert_snapshot!(msg, @r###"
870        Error: can't compare apples with oranges
871           ,-[<unknown>:1:1]
872           |
873         1 | apple == orange;
874           | ^^|^^    ^^^|^^  
875           |   `-------------- This is an apple
876           |             |    
877           |             `---- This is an orange
878        ---'
879        "###);
880    }
881
882    #[test]
883    fn label_at_end_of_long_line() {
884        let source = format!("{}orange", "apple == ".repeat(100));
885        let msg = Report::<Range<usize>>::build(ReportKind::Error, (), 0)
886            .with_config(no_color_and_ascii())
887            .with_message("can't compare apples with oranges")
888            .with_label(
889                Label::new(source.len() - 5..source.len()).with_message("This is an orange"),
890            )
891            .finish()
892            .write_to_string(Source::from(source));
893        // TODO: it would be nice if the start of long lines would be omitted (like rustc does)
894        assert_snapshot!(msg, @r###"
895        Error: can't compare apples with oranges
896           ,-[<unknown>:1:1]
897           |
898         1 | apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == apple == orange
899           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      ^^|^^  
900           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        `---- This is an orange
901        ---'
902        "###);
903    }
904
905    #[test]
906    fn multiline_label() {
907        let source = "apple\n==\norange";
908        let msg = Report::<Range<usize>>::build(ReportKind::Error, (), 0)
909            .with_config(no_color_and_ascii())
910            .with_label(Label::new(0..source.len()).with_message("illegal comparison"))
911            .finish()
912            .write_to_string(Source::from(source));
913        // TODO: it would be nice if the 2nd line wasn't omitted
914        assert_snapshot!(msg, @r###"
915        Error: 
916           ,-[<unknown>:1:1]
917           |
918         1 | ,-> apple
919           : :   
920         3 | |-> orange
921           | |           
922           | `----------- illegal comparison
923        ---'
924        "###);
925    }
926
927    #[test]
928    fn partially_overlapping_labels() {
929        let source = "https://example.com/";
930        let msg = Report::<Range<usize>>::build(ReportKind::Error, (), 0)
931            .with_config(no_color_and_ascii())
932            .with_label(Label::new(0..source.len()).with_message("URL"))
933            .with_label(Label::new(0..source.find(':').unwrap()).with_message("scheme"))
934            .finish()
935            .write_to_string(Source::from(source));
936        // TODO: it would be nice if you could tell where the spans start and end.
937        assert_snapshot!(msg, @r###"
938        Error: 
939           ,-[<unknown>:1:1]
940           |
941         1 | https://example.com/
942           | ^^|^^^^^^^|^^^^^^^^^  
943           |   `------------------- scheme
944           |           |           
945           |           `----------- URL
946        ---'
947        "###);
948    }
949
950    #[test]
951    fn multiple_labels_same_span() {
952        let source = "apple == orange;";
953        let msg = Report::<Range<usize>>::build(ReportKind::Error, (), 0)
954            .with_config(no_color_and_ascii())
955            .with_message("can't compare apples with oranges")
956            .with_label(Label::new(0..5).with_message("This is an apple"))
957            .with_label(Label::new(0..5).with_message("Have I mentioned that this is an apple?"))
958            .with_label(Label::new(0..5).with_message("No really, have I mentioned that?"))
959            .with_label(Label::new(9..15).with_message("This is an orange"))
960            .with_label(Label::new(9..15).with_message("Have I mentioned that this is an orange?"))
961            .with_label(Label::new(9..15).with_message("No really, have I mentioned that?"))
962            .finish()
963            .write_to_string(Source::from(source));
964        assert_snapshot!(msg, @r###"
965        Error: can't compare apples with oranges
966           ,-[<unknown>:1:1]
967           |
968         1 | apple == orange;
969           | ^^|^^    ^^^|^^  
970           |   `-------------- This is an apple
971           |   |         |    
972           |   `-------------- Have I mentioned that this is an apple?
973           |   |         |    
974           |   `-------------- No really, have I mentioned that?
975           |             |    
976           |             `---- This is an orange
977           |             |    
978           |             `---- Have I mentioned that this is an orange?
979           |             |    
980           |             `---- No really, have I mentioned that?
981        ---'
982        "###)
983    }
984
985    #[test]
986    fn note() {
987        let source = "apple == orange;";
988        let msg = Report::<Range<usize>>::build(ReportKind::Error, (), 0)
989            .with_config(no_color_and_ascii())
990            .with_message("can't compare apples with oranges")
991            .with_label(Label::new(0..5).with_message("This is an apple"))
992            .with_label(Label::new(9..15).with_message("This is an orange"))
993            .with_note("stop trying ... this is a fruitless endeavor")
994            .finish()
995            .write_to_string(Source::from(source));
996        assert_snapshot!(msg, @r###"
997        Error: can't compare apples with oranges
998           ,-[<unknown>:1:1]
999           |
1000         1 | apple == orange;
1001           | ^^|^^    ^^^|^^  
1002           |   `-------------- This is an apple
1003           |             |    
1004           |             `---- This is an orange
1005           | 
1006           | Note: stop trying ... this is a fruitless endeavor
1007        ---'
1008        "###)
1009    }
1010
1011    #[test]
1012    fn help() {
1013        let source = "apple == orange;";
1014        let msg = Report::<Range<usize>>::build(ReportKind::Error, (), 0)
1015            .with_config(no_color_and_ascii())
1016            .with_message("can't compare apples with oranges")
1017            .with_label(Label::new(0..5).with_message("This is an apple"))
1018            .with_label(Label::new(9..15).with_message("This is an orange"))
1019            .with_help("have you tried peeling the orange?")
1020            .finish()
1021            .write_to_string(Source::from(source));
1022        assert_snapshot!(msg, @r###"
1023        Error: can't compare apples with oranges
1024           ,-[<unknown>:1:1]
1025           |
1026         1 | apple == orange;
1027           | ^^|^^    ^^^|^^  
1028           |   `-------------- This is an apple
1029           |             |    
1030           |             `---- This is an orange
1031           | 
1032           | Help: have you tried peeling the orange?
1033        ---'
1034        "###)
1035    }
1036
1037    #[test]
1038    fn help_and_note() {
1039        let source = "apple == orange;";
1040        let msg = Report::<Range<usize>>::build(ReportKind::Error, (), 0)
1041            .with_config(no_color_and_ascii())
1042            .with_message("can't compare apples with oranges")
1043            .with_label(Label::new(0..5).with_message("This is an apple"))
1044            .with_label(Label::new(9..15).with_message("This is an orange"))
1045            .with_help("have you tried peeling the orange?")
1046            .with_note("stop trying ... this is a fruitless endeavor")
1047            .finish()
1048            .write_to_string(Source::from(source));
1049        assert_snapshot!(msg, @r###"
1050        Error: can't compare apples with oranges
1051           ,-[<unknown>:1:1]
1052           |
1053         1 | apple == orange;
1054           | ^^|^^    ^^^|^^  
1055           |   `-------------- This is an apple
1056           |             |    
1057           |             `---- This is an orange
1058           | 
1059           | Help: have you tried peeling the orange?
1060           | 
1061           | Note: stop trying ... this is a fruitless endeavor
1062        ---'
1063        "###)
1064    }
1065}
